page.title: 01BRILL-GENERAL INFORMATION.
page.content: Brill is 5 miles from Thame and 9 miles west of Aylesbury.The village is situated on a high hill about 90 to 100 metres above other surrounding villages and countryside.Four roads meet in the centre of the village.The north west side of the village is covered by an extensive common covering a large area.Some small woods are dotted around the outskirts of Brill.They were part of the ancient Bernewode Forest which covered this part of Buckinghamshire.Brill manufactured tiles,pottery and especially bricks from the 13th.c.to the 19th.c..The common is dented by pits and bumps which were once busy with men working and digging for clay. A 17th.c.post mill stands here. Although Brill thrived for centuries on local industry it remains unspoilt and self contained.
